answers.answer: Well cheese is a milk product. I bet it is in your diet. Certain foods, especially garlic and asperagus can cause such odor. You also may want to visit your Doctor to have your thyroid and blood chemistries checked. Is there Diabetes in your family. ?

question: For the past several months I have had a pungent odor from skin areas that are exposed to sunlight.Things are fine and then the sunlight will hit the oil on my skin and a pungent odor leaps to life. It isnot sweat because it happens even if I am not hot. It is resident in the oil secreted by my skin. I thoughtit was Vitamin D and milk products but I haven't been eating any milk products and it still happens.I also noticed it starting when I started eating Amish cheese and lots of it. Any doctor I talk to says, "Ihave no idea, it is the weirdest thing I have ever heard of." They think it is bacterial based and suggestdeodorants but that is not the problem.Anyone have any ideas
title: Oily Skin Odor
